ALFACALCIDOL

VITAMIN D AND ANALOGUES (SYSTEMIC)

  • Indications and doses
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Cautions
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Patients with severe renal impairment requiring vitamin D therapy,

By mouth or by intravenous injection

  • For adults
    Initially 1 microgram daily, dose to be adjusted to avoid hypercalcaemia; maintenance 0.25–1 microgram daily.
  • For adults elderly
    Initially 500 nanograms daily, dose adjusted to avoid hypercalcaemia; maintenance 0.25–1 microgram daily.

Hypophosphataemic rickets, Persistent hypocalcaemia due to hypoparathyroidism or pseudohypoparathyroidism,

By mouth or by intravenous injection

  • For children 1 month–11 years
    25–50 nanograms/kg once daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary; maximum 1 microgram per day.
  • For children 12–17 years
    1 microgram once daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary.

Prevention of vitamin D deficiency in renal or cholestatic liver disease,

By mouth or by intravenous injection

  • For children 1 month–11 years (body-weight up to 20 kg)
    15–30 nanograms/kg once daily (max. per dose 500 nanograms).
  • For children 1 month–11 years (body-weight 20 kg and above)
    250–500 nanograms once daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary.
  • For children 12–17 years
    250–500 nanograms once daily, dose to be adjusted as necessary.

Dose equivalence and conversion

One drop of alfacalcidol 2 microgram/mL oral drops contains approximately 100 nanograms alfacalcidol.

Known side effects

General side effects

rare: Nephrocalcinosis, pruritus, rash, urticaria,

Directions for administration

With intravenous use

For injection, shake ampoule for at least 5 seconds before use, and give over 30 seconds.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Nephrolithiasis
  • take care to ensure correct dose in infants

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor plasma-calcium concentration in patients receiving high doses.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

The concentration of alfacalcidol in One-Alpha drops is 10 times greater than that of the former preparation One-Alpha solution.

Prepared medicinal forms of ALFACALCIDOL

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral suspension, oral solution,
Capsule
Oral drops
Solution for injection
